events.message: The insured reported a car accident that occurred at an intersection with significant front-end damage to the vehicle.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and damage description.
An agent specializing in vehicle collision claims was assigned to handle the investigation and customer communications.
The insured received confirmation that the claim was acknowledged and the process had started promptly.
To proceed, the insured was asked to submit the police report, photos of the damage, and a completed claim form.
All requested documents, including police and repair shop reports, were submitted by the insured within the requested timeframe.
The investigation into the collision circumstances and liability began based on the submitted documentation.
Investigation concluded that the insured was not at fault and damage repair costs were verified and approved.
A settlement amount covering damages and rental car expenses was proposed to the insured for review.
The insured expressed satisfaction with the handling of the claim and agreed to the proposed settlement promptly.
Approval was granted for the proposed settlement after all necessary reviews and customer acceptance.
The payment covering vehicle repairs and additional costs was issued to the insured without delays.
The claim was officially closed following successful settlements and customer confirmations.
All claim documents and communications were archived securely for future reference and auditing purposes.
